Sentencas: Functionally graded and continuously aligned pore structures have been fabricated by a modified tape-casting process for use as solid oxide fuel cell electrodes, catalysts, sensors, and filtration/separation devices.
Titulo: Fabrication of functionally graded and aligned porosity in thin ceramic substrates with the novel freeze-tape-casting process

Sentencas: Pore gradients from < 5 to 100 mu m and aligned pore tubules have been directly fabricated in various ceramic materials with thin substrate sections approximately 500-1500 mu m utilizing both low-toxicity aqueous-based slips and organic solvents.
Titulo: Fabrication of functionally graded and aligned porosity in thin ceramic substrates with the novel freeze-tape-casting process

Sentencas: This process allows for the generation of pores without the use of thermally fugitive pore formers in a single processing step with no need for tape lamination.
Titulo: Fabrication of functionally graded and aligned porosity in thin ceramic substrates with the novel freeze-tape-casting process

Sentencas: The incorporation of tape casting, unidirectional solidification, and the freeze-drying process results in uniformly acicular pores aligned with the direction of the moving carrier film.
Titulo: Fabrication of functionally graded and aligned porosity in thin ceramic substrates with the novel freeze-tape-casting process

Sentencas: Processing and microstructure variability will be discussed as it pertains to the effects of solids loading, freezing temperatures, and solvent type.
Titulo: Fabrication of functionally graded and aligned porosity in thin ceramic substrates with the novel freeze-tape-casting process

Sentencas: Applications for this ceramic processing technology will also be discussed.
Titulo: Fabrication of functionally graded and aligned porosity in thin ceramic substrates with the novel freeze-tape-casting process
